intro: Bumelia nicaraguensis, commonly known as the Nicaraguan bumelia, is a tropical tree native to Central America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, gray bark and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in clusters, followed by woody capsules containing numerous seeds. It thrives in humid, lowland areas and is often found in secondary forests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
